definitions.definition: a performance by musicians playing popular music or jazz in front of an audience; a similar performance by a comedian

examples.text: They're doing a gig in Boston tonight.
He played with the band at a recent gig.
The guide lists live music events in the area, including pub gigs.

definitions.definition: a job, especially a temporary one

examples.text: She landed her first gig on a kids' TV show.
a gig as a basketball coach

definitions.definition: a unit of computer memory or data, equal to 109, or 1 0003, (= 1000000000) bytes
a unit of computer memory or data, equal to 230, or 1 0243, (= 1073741824) bytes
a small light carriage with two wheels, pulled by one horse

wordOrigin: sense 4 late 18th cent.: apparently a transferred sense of obsolete gig ‘a flighty girl’, which was also applied to various objects or devices that whirled.senses 1 to 2 1920s: of unknown origin.
